title: Teachers Unions Don't Really Strike for 'the Kids'
summary: When the United Auto Workers walk off the job, no one pretends they care about car buyers.. When the United Auto Workers walk off the job, no one pretends that they are acting in the interests of car buyers. Everyone knows union members want better wages, benefits, working conditions and job protections, and going on strike is an effective way to exert pressure on employers.

title: To Handicap Best Picture, Check Out This Other Oscar Category
summary: Unusually, many of the Oscar nominees for best picture are popular hits. But the more obscure nods for best director may better predict the winner.. This year, the motion picture academy solved a problem that has bedeviled it for years: Many of the movies it nominated for best picture are films that people have actually seen.

title: A Bipartisan Shutdown Solution
summary: The only way forward is a deal to legalize the Dreamers and fund the border wall.. As the government shutdown enters its second month, our divided political system appears no closer to a resolution than when this disgraceful and unnecessary standoff began. There's an obvious way to end it-and to ensure a fiasco like this never happens again.

title: 'Bankers and Bolsheviks' Review: The Red Ink of Red October
summary: Foreign lenders initially welcomed the fall of the czar. Then Lenin repudiated Russia's debt-the biggest sovereign default in history.. With "Bankers and Bolsheviks: International Finance and the Russian Revolution," Hassan Malik has written a fascinating study of an overlooked topic-but not a book for emerging markets investors who like to sleep soundly at night. Mr. Malik chronicles the involvement of foreign capital in Russia before and up to the October Revolution. It ends expensively. Shortly after taking power in 1917, the Bolsheviks repudiated Russia's debts. Adjusted for inflation, this remains the biggest sovereign default in history, made costlier by its completeness. No debts or obligations were "restructured": With token exceptions, the money was gone for good.

title: IBM Earnings Top Expectations
summary: Revenue drops 3.5%, but company swings to a profit for the quarter. International Business Machines Corp. said revenue fell 3.5% in the fourth quarter, another setback in its yearslong quest to recapture growth, but its signal that faster-growing businesses would help boost profit this year sent shares higher.

title: Viacom Acquires Video-Streaming Service Pluto TV
summary: Owner of Nickelodeon and MTV to expand digital footprint and boost online ad business with deal. Viacom Inc. said it bought the ad-supported video-streaming service Pluto TV for $340 million in cash, a move that gives the pay-television giant another entrée to the realm of online video.

title: Mariano Rivera Elected Unanimously to Baseball Hall of Fame
summary: Nobody could hit the former Yankees closer except Edgar Martinez. Now, they will enter baseball's Hall of Fame together.. Mariano Rivera made a lot of very good baseball players look very bad for a very long time. A total of 993 different hitters recorded at least one at-bat against Rivera during his 19-year major-league career with the New York Yankees. Close to two-thirds of them posted a batting average of .200 or worse against him, with nearly half failing to record a single hit off Rivera and his magical cut fastball.

title: A Fierce Battle Over Women in Combat Units
summary: Women have been in combat since the start of the global war on terror and continually have proven themselves as combat necessary and effective.. If a picture is worth a thousand words, Heather Mac Donald need not have written her op-ed decrying women's integration into military combat units ("Women Don't Belong in Combat Units," Jan. 14). The photo accompanying her piece was enough. What's missing from her analysis on the issue, however, is something female service members already know-an off-kilter helmet isn't a sign of an undisciplined female Marine, but a symptom of a military whose uniforms and policies have not been adjusted for women's bodies. Ms. MacDonald points to a 2015 Marine Corps study of an all-female unit's performance, despite the widely known critique of its questionable research methods by military leaders and researchers alike.

title: Buy Now, Pay Later Philosophy Means Debt
summary: We cannot be great if we go broke.. Regarding Steve H. Hanke and Stephen J.K. Walters's op-ed "Lying Prices Keeping America Hooked on Spending" (Jan. 8): Repeated efforts to control the national debt have failed because those in Washington have defaulted on their responsibility to lead. A previous attempt entitled "National Commission on Fiscal Responsibility and Reform," created in 2010 by President Obama and chaired by Alan Simpson and Erskine Bowles, was championed as a bipartisan presidential commission on deficit reduction. The Bowles-Simpson report never officially came to a vote because both parties in Washington ignored the national interest in favor of special interests.

title: Early Government Gag Rule
summary: John Quincy Adams, while in Congress in 1836, assailed the congressional gag rule pertaining to slavery.. Regarding your editorial "Shut up, the SEC Explained" (Jan. 18): John Quincy Adams, while in Congress in 1836, assailed the congressional gag rule pertaining to slavery as a clear violation of his own constitutional right to free speech and the right of his constituents to petition government for redress of grievances. Only in 1844, years after his first request to abolish the gag rule, did he succeed. Free speech is a constitutional right!

title: Judge Gives iHeartMedia Green Light to Exit Bankruptcy
summary: Decision ends nearly three-year restructuring journey for biggest U.S. radio network. A bankruptcy court judge on Tuesday confirmed iHeartMedia Inc.'s restructuring plan that allows the company to slash its debt load and hand over control to a group of bondholders.

title: In Chicago, Another Daley Looks to Revive a Dynasty
summary: Son and brother of former mayors faces crowded field in next month's election. CHICAGO-In a crowded field to succeed Rahm Emanuel as this city's next mayor, Bill Daley isn't lacking for name recognition. Whether that ultimately helps or hurts him will be decided by voters late next month.

title: State Department's Top Official for Europe Is Set to Leave
summary: A. Wess Mitchell says his accomplishments include helping Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's transition to his current role. The State Department's top official for European affairs is leaving the Trump administration after 15 months, he said in a letter released Tuesday.

title: Consumer-Safety Watchdog Sidelined by Government Shutdown
summary: The agency isn't able to publicize and assist companies with product recalls. WASHINGTON-Specialized Bicycle Components Inc. warned customers last week to stop riding four bike models because of a steering-tube component that can crack and cause the rider to lose control.

title: Connecticut's Federal Workers Eligible for Zero-Interest Loans
summary: Measure is first bill signed into law by Democratic Gov. Ned Lamont. Connecticut Gov. Ned Lamont on Tuesday signed his first law, which allows federal workers to apply for zero-interest bank loans while the government remains shut down.

title: Pakistan Turns to Gulf Countries to Keep Economy Afloat
summary: With 'open for business' strategy, Imran Khan draws billions and delays IMF reckoning. ISLAMABAD-Prime Minister Imran Khan has opened a new chapter in Pakistan's long history of using its strategic position to win foreign support-this time turning to Arab Gulf nations to help keep the economy afloat.

title: Accel Returns to Market Seeking $2.5 Billion for Three Funds
summary: The new year is off to a strong start for VC fundraising as two large firms, Accel and Andreessen Horowitz, tap LPs for new capital. Accel is back in the market with a plan to raise $2.5 billion for three new funds, according to a person familiar with the situation.

title: EQT Rejects Rice Proposal to Shake Up Management
summary: Shale driller, which merged with Rice Energy, announces cost-cutting steps as it rejects Rice family proposal to take over running combined company. A battle for control of America's largest natural-gas producer may be headed for a shareholder vote, after EQT Corp. failed to reach agreement with brothers who sold Rice Energy Inc. to EQT for $6.7 billion in 2017.

title: Transgender Woman Says NYPD Falsely Accused Her of Misrepresenting Herself
summary: In a suit filed by the New York Civil Liberties Union, Linda Dominguez accuses officers of harassing her and violating departmental rules. A Bronx transgender woman was wrongfully charged with misrepresenting herself after she gave her former and legally changed names to New York Police Department officers who arrested her for trespassing, according to a new lawsuit.

title: Justice Department Pushes for Supreme Court Review of Census Case
summary: Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross to testify before Congress on census citizenship question. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department on Tuesday said it plans to ask the Supreme Court to expeditiously review a federal judge's ruling that Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross's efforts to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census broke the law.

title: Arconic Scuttles Deal to Sell to Apollo Global
summary: Aluminum-parts manufacturer nixes potential $10 billion buyout by private-equity firm. Arconic Inc. said it won't sell the company after a monthslong auction process, a surprise move nixing a proposed deal with private-equity firm Apollo Global Management LLC.

title: American Charged With Spying in Russia 'Didn't Know He Had State Secrets'
summary: Paul Whelan's lawyer said his client was unaware a flash drive he was given contained classified material. MOSCOW-An American man detained in Russia in December on spying charges had what authorities said were state secrets in his possession when he was arrested but didn't know he had them or what they were, his lawyer said.

title: Hedge Fund Drops Proxy Battle With Chemicals Maker Ashland
summary: Cruiser Capital Advisors agrees to withdraw its slate of board nominees and back the company's choices. New York-based hedge fund Cruiser Capital Advisors LLC is abandoning its proxy fight with Ashland Global Holdings Inc. after the specialty-chemicals manufacturer struck a deal last week with investor Neuberger Berman Group LLC.

title: Emerging-Market Currencies Drop
summary: Worries over a slowdown in China's economy pushed some investors out of comparatively risky currencies and into havens. Emerging-market currencies fell against the dollar on Tuesday, weighed down by concerns over global growth.

title: Shutdown Sidelines Safety Inspections of Imported Products
summary: Unchecked toys, household appliances, exercise equipment could pose safety hazard. WASHINGTON-The partial government shutdown over President Trump's demand to wall off the Mexican border has opened up a hole for unsafe products to enter the U.S., the head of the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission said Tuesday.

title: Cinematic Treasures From an Unexpected Place
summary: The films of Romanian director Cristian Mungiu, such as '4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days' and 'Graduation,' are subtle investigations of human behavior and society..

title: Readers Weigh In on How to Dress for Work
summary: Readers responded to our recent article on how traditional dress codes for the work place are falling away. Wall Street, the last bastion of a traditional corporate dress code, has been loosening its tie as male bankers increasingly take sartorial cues from clients. When the Journal's Telis Demos and Ray A. Smith reported on the trend in a Jan. 12 article, readers shared their thoughts on how men and women should dress for business. Below, edited responses.

title: 'Lucio Fontana: On the Threshold' Review: Creativity That Cuts Against the Grain
summary: Fontana came to painting late in life, but his slashed canvases were a radical attempt to explore a new kind of space.. Radical gestures have been a staple of modern art-particularly European modern art-at least since 1913, when, as Marcel Duchamp recounted, "I had the happy idea to fasten a bicycle wheel to a kitchen stool and watch it turn." Over the past century, we've had, in addition to countless enigmatic works of performance art, Man Ray wrapping a sewing machine in an army blanket in 1920 and calling it "The Enigma of Isidore Ducasse," Salvador Dalí turning a lobster into the receiver on an old-fashioned telephone (1936), Niki de Saint Phalle shooting a rifle at paint bags (1961), and Yves Klein making a "fire painting" with a big blowtorch in 1962. Americans, to be sure, have added to the list with the likes of Robert Rauschenberg's "Erased De Kooning Drawing" (1953) and Robert Morris's riding horses back and forth to gouge a line in a ranch's turf in 1969.

title: Brazil's New President Takes Measured Tone in Davos Address
summary: Jair Bolsonaro puts bellicose rhetoric aside, promises to make country safer and more business-friendly, but short speech is short on details. Brazil's new president, Jair Bolsonaro, toned down his fiery rhetoric at the World Economic Forum while pledging to make his country safer and more business-friendly.

title: Stocks Decline on Growth Worries
summary: Major indexes take first loss in five trading sessions as Dow industrials shed over 300 points. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell more than 300 points Tuesday, the blue-chip index's first decline in five trading sessions, as concerns over trade and global growth resurfaced.

title: U.S. Government Bonds Rise on Global Growth Concerns
summary: Investors seek safer assets amid decelerating growth in China, dip in German economic sentiment. U.S. government bond prices rose Tuesday as investors sought safer assets amid rising concerns about the pace of global economic growth.

title: Stock Market's Next Hurdle: Tech and Industrial Earnings
summary: Quarterly results from companies like Intel, IBM and Ford could shake up the market's recent calm. Investors enjoying tranquility in the stock market are facing a new source of potential volatility: the quarterly earnings of industrial and technology companies that start reporting this week.

title: North Carolina Judge Declines to Certify Winner of Disputed Congressional Race
summary: Lawyers for Republican Mark Harris, who led in the balloting, says fight could mean district could be without representation for the two-year House term. RALEIGH, N. C.-A state judge denied Republican Mark Harris's request to be certified the winner of a disputed Congressional race, increasing the likelihood the Charlotte-based seat will remain open for months.

title: Harris Raised $1.5 Million in First 24 Hours After Announcing Candidacy
summary: California Democrat's funds came from 38,000 donors, including $1 million in first 12 hours. WASHINGTON-Sen. Kamala Harris raised $1.5 million from 38,000 donors online in the 24 hours after announcing her presidential run Monday morning, her campaign said.

title: Home Sales Sank 6.4% in December
summary: Decline of 6.4% suggests sluggishness in the housing market may persist into 2019. Home sales tumbled in December to their weakest level since 2015, ending a difficult year at a new low and offering fresh evidence that the housing market could be in for a bumpy ride in 2019.

title: New Caravan Grows as Mexico Eases Passage
summary: Central Americans crowd Mexico's southern border awaiting humanitarian visas to pass unhindered toward U.S.. TECÚN UMÁN, Guatemala-A caravan of Central American migrants seeking to reach the U.S. is set to swell in coming days as thousands gather at Mexico's southern border waiting for humanitarian visas that have become much easier to get under Mexico's new government.

title: Cafe Chain Patisserie, Now in Administration, Will Search For Buyer
summary: The move follows accounting fraud allegations and will prompt the closure of at least 70 stores. U.K. cafe chain operator Patisserie Holdings PLC said Tuesday that it has gone into administration.

summary: The company is working to implement a deal with the U.S. that lifts sanctions. Two private-equity executives were among the three people chosen to exercise voting rights on certain shares of EN+ Group PLC that will be relinquished as part of a deal to remove U.S. sanctions on the company.

title: Colony Capital Nears Deal to Buy Abraaj's Latin American Business
summary: U.S. investment manager is likely to pay less than $10 million for the assets. Colony Capital Inc. is nearing a deal to take over the Latin American operations of troubled Dubai-based private-equity firm Abraaj Group, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Metro-North Riders to Face Longer Commutes
summary: Officials say extra time is needed to accommodate slowdowns due to infrastructure work. Metro-North Railroad will extend commute times for tens of thousands of riders this year in a bid to improve reliability.

title: Oil Falls on Fresh Demand Worries
summary: Analysts expect slower growth in China and around the world to lower consumption of materials. · Oil prices fell Tuesday, pausing a recent recovery on fresh worries that slower global economic growth will lead to lower fuel consumption.

title: Another Meal Company Folds Its Apron
summary: Munchery is the latest meal company to find it lacks the scale to thrive, but none compete on price with restaurants or supermarkets. That sound you heard was another few hundred million dollars of venture capitalists' money being chewed up.

title: Singer Chris Brown Detained in Paris Over Rape Allegation
summary: Police took Mr. Brown into custody and were questioning him on suspicion of aggravated rape and violating laws on narcotics. PARIS-French authorities detained American R&B singer Chris Brown after a woman accused him of raping her in the French capital, according to a judicial official.

title: Can Activist Lightning Strike Twice for eBay?
summary: An activist pushes for key asset spinoffs, but what is left may disappoint. EBay shares jumped Tuesday on news that a well-known pair of activist investors has taken positions in the e-commerce company.

title: Starboard, Elliott Management Call On eBay to Shed StubHub, Classifieds
summary: The activist investors have stakes in the e-commerce company; shares of eBay come alive after long slump. Two big hedge-fund investors are circling eBay Inc. and suggesting it part ways with its StubHub ticketing and classified-ads businesses, moves that could again fracture the company at the hands of activists.

title: High Court Allows Temporary Ban on Transgender Troops
summary: High court also declines to take up a case at center of immigration fight in Washington. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court intervened on one Trump administration priority Tuesday but sidestepped another, allowing restrictions on military service by transgender individuals to be put in place while avoiding for now the White House's bid to cancel protections for some young illegal immigrants.

title: Nathan Glazer and Conservatism
summary: A trenchant critic of liberal schemes for social reform.. There is much talk in the chattering class about a supposed fracture between the social right and economic conservatives. Will populists and traditionalists break with limited-government Republicans who prize markets? The work of Harvard sociologist Nathan Glazer, who died Saturday at age 95, is a reminder that the priorities of the two groups overlap and reinforce one another more than many acknowledge.

title: Johnson & Johnson Expects Sales Growth to Slow
summary: Company cites pricing pressures, generic-drug competition. Johnson & Johnson said it expects its sales growth to slow in 2019, citing pricing pressures and generic-drug competition for its pharmaceutical division.

title: The U.S. May Have to Rethink Its Approach to North Korea
summary: Resume Subscription. SEOUL-A year of intense diplomacy, including the first summit between a sitting U.S. president and a North Korean leader, has helped dial back tensions on the Korean Peninsula.

title: U.K. Regulator Launches Second Investigation Into KPMG Over Carillion Audit
summary: Probe relates to documents KPMG submitted to the Financial Reporting Council in 2017, before Carillion's collapse. title: The Housing Blues Won't Be Over Soon
summary: The decline in mortgage rates helps, but won't be enough to get housing's recovery going again. Lower interest rates are giving would-be home buyers more of a reason to go ahead and get that house. Everything else is giving them less of a reason to pull the trigger, though.

title: Travelers Posts Higher Profit Despite Larger Catastrophe Losses
summary: Insurance firm's revenue rose 4.6% in the latest quarter. Travelers Cos. 's fourth-quarter profit rose from a year ago, when the insurance firm recorded a $129 million charge related to changes in the U.S. tax code, despite an increase in catastrophe losses.

title: IBM Revenue Trends in Reverse
summary: Red Hat, move toward cloud computing to be scrutinized in earnings report. International Business Machines Corp. is scheduled to report fourth-quarter earnings after the close of trading Tuesday. Here is what to expect:

title: Why Women Crave 'French Style,' and Men Want International Style
summary: Women around the world strive for chic "French Girl" style, yet for men, no such template exists. Why that is reveals much about how homogenized men's fashion has become. ON MY FIRST NIGHT in Paris to see the fall menswear collections last week, I passed a young man wearing a weathered cowboy hat, a checkered flannel shirt and a pair of "how can he walk in those?" skinny jeans. It was the sort of outfit that would look more at home in a Los Angeles coffee shop populated by ironic Silver Lake hipsters than a side-street off the ritzy, historic Place Vendôme, so I assumed he was American. Yet, as I got closer, I heard him jabbering away in seemingly native French to his female companion. In a shin-skimming black coat and slim pants, she was the very picture of "French style," one of the many women I'd see dressed "Parisian" over the next week. So why wasn't he wearing something equally stereotypical: a black turtleneck-or at least a scarf knotted in "this old thing?" fashion?

title: A Vintage Motorcycle's Lucky Number
summary: Resume Subscription. Shasta Smith, 41, interior architect, star of the 2014 TV show "Red Hot Design" and owner of the Vintage Monkey motorcycle-restoration shop in Sacramento, Calif., on her 1972 Honda CB175, as told to A.J. Baime.

summary: Lawsuits over baby powder are no longer the only worry for Johnson & Johnson investors as pharmaceutical sales come under price and sales pressure. Fourth-quarter results from J&J on Tuesday highlight a more immediate risk: slowing growth.

summary: Cups, plates and utensils are clogging up landfills due to poor labeling and a lack of commercial facilities. Compostable bags, cups and cutlery are becoming more popular amid the mounting backlash against plastic waste, but many aren't making it to the compost heap.

summary: Employers flood the ranking site with 5-star postings requested from enthusiastic staffers, leading to unusual spikes, a WSJ investigation found. title: 'Roma' and 'The Favourite' Lead Oscar Nominations With 10 Each
summary: Academy names eight movies for best picture. "Roma" and "The Favourite" took the lead in the Oscar race, receiving 10 nominations each, including best picture and best lead actress, when the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced its nominees on Tuesday.

summary: Bolstering power networks against extreme events can require billions of dollars but some utilities are taking smaller measures. From wind-driven wildfires to massive hurricanes, extreme weather poses challenges for utilities, often causing power networks to fail-sometimes with deadly consequences.

title: Why Forgetfulness Might Actually Help You
summary: An absent-minded moment may actually be a sign of a healthy level of creativity or focus. Many people worry that forgetting names, facts or tasks on their to-do list is a sign of aging or mental decline.

title: Dry January Has New York Bartenders Mixing $10 Mocktails

title: Renault to Name Carlos Ghosn Successor at Thursday Meeting
summary: French auto maker is set to promote deputy chief Thierry Bolloré to CEO as current chief sits in Tokyo jail. PARIS- Renault SA plans to name a successor to jailed Chairman and Chief Executive Carlos Ghosn at a board meeting Thursday, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that would end the reign of an executive whose more-than-two-decade stint at the French car maker made him an auto-industry star.

summary: Workers at the Seafront Towers headquarters use facial recognition technology and an official WeChat app for employees. title: Bunge Names Heckman Acting CEO, Warns on Profits

title: Former Fannie Mae Chief Joins Blend, a Mortgage Startup
summary: Timothy Mayopoulos returned the housing-finance giant to profitability during his six years as CEO. Former Fannie Mae chief Timothy Mayopoulos is joining mortgage-software startup Blend Labs Inc., becoming one of the highest-profile executives to jump into the financial-technology sector.

title: Auto Investors Should Buckle Up for Tariff Threats
summary: The German car industry could become collateral damage in tough U.S.-EU trade negotiations. summary: A top investor pens a bad review, but its ideas for improvement at the company may fall flat. One of Yelp 's top investors minces no words in its feedback. Seeing results will prove to be a tall order, though.

summary: UBS and rivals like Morgan Stanley have become asset gatherers, which was great while markets rose and rose. One of the better bank strategies of recent years has been to focus less on deals and more on fees. That approach now faces a severe test.

summary: Apps such as Robinhood and Webull are drawing in young and often inexperienced investors; 'bringing the ability to make foolish decisions to an ever-broader swath of people'. title: Tencent Still Isn't Feeling the Love From Beijing
summary: Chinese regulators have started issuing videogames approvals, but the world's biggest producer hasn't been among the recipients. Tencent's investors have seen the light at the end of the tunnel after a grim year. The walk out may yet take a while.

title: Ad-Tech In-Housing Company Beeswax Raises $15 Million
summary: Investors are backing efforts to help marketers handle ad duties themselves. Beeswax.io Corp, an ad-tech firm that helps marketers build their own in-house digital ad-buying capabilities, has raised $15 million in a new funding round, the company said, another sign of the growing interest in marketers seizing more control of their advertising functions.

title: Wall Street Backlash Sinks Plan to Transform Swaps Market
summary: CFTC's Giancarlo plans to walk away from proposal after pushback from Goldman, Citadel Securities. WASHINGTON-Faced with criticism from firms such as Citadel Securities and Goldman Sachs Group Inc., a Republican regulator plans to withdraw a revamp of rules for products used to hedge risks and make bets on everything from fuel prices to interest rates.

title: Silicon Valley's Unbridled Optimism Gets Fresh Reality Check
summary: Rout of publicly traded tech firms fosters newfound restraint for investors in younger startups. SAN FRANCISCO-Messaging startup Hustle projected the picture of Silicon Valley largess. The company spent millions of dollars raised from investors such as Alphabet Inc. on expensive new hires, on-tap kombucha, arcade games and a six-figure salary for its pedigreed chief executive.

title: China's Plan for Tech Dominance Is Advancing, Business Groups Say
summary: Critical report on 'Made in China 2025' issued as U.S.-China trade talks are set to resume next week. Two influential U.S. business groups have issued a report detailing how China is moving ahead with a technology policy set to be a key point of contention in the U.S.-China trade talks that resume next week in Washington.

title: iPhone Assembler Weighs India Move, Cutting Apple's Reliance on China
summary: Senior executives plan to visit India in February to discuss plans. Apple Inc.'s largest iPhone assembler, Foxconn Technology Group, is considering producing the devices in India, people familiar with the matter said, a move that could reduce Apple's dependence on China for manufacturing and potentially for sales.

title: Apple Supplier in Japan Looks to Taiwan for Bailout After iPhone XR Letdown
summary: Japan Display is in advanced talks with Taiwan's TPK Holding and Chinese state-owned Silk Road Fund. TOKYO-The disappointing performance of Apple Inc.'s iPhone XR is rippling through the global supply chain, leading a major Japanese supplier for the model to seek a bailout from an investor group from China and Taiwan.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Smartphone Giant Pivots From IPO to Buybacks Within Months
summary: Resume Subscription. China's Xiaomi Corp. is buying back stock barely six months after going public in Hong Kong.

title: China Annual Economic Growth Rate Is Slowest Since 1990
summary: Economic slowdown deepened in the final months of 2018. BEIJING-China's economic expansion languished to its slowest pace in nearly three decades last year, as a bruising trade fight with the U.S. exacerbated weakness in the world's second-largest economy.

title: Air Travel Remains Safe During Shutdown, Data Show
summary: Rate of planes coming too close to each other hasn't changed, but air-traffic controllers' resources 'are starting to run thin,' union official says. U.S. aviation officials have compiled data that statistically support, for the first time, Trump administration statements that the partial government shutdown hasn't jeopardized air-traffic-control safety.

title: How China Exploits Anti-Soviet Money Policy
summary: The dollar's role as the global reserve currency has let China become the world's factory floor.. In its quest to dominate global markets, China is upending the rules that make them run in the first place. Beijing's mercantilist strategy-using revenue from cheap exports to finance railways, ports and other footholds in its client states-is disrupting the international trade system. Left unchecked, China's tactics will continue hampering developing economies while also displacing workers in the U.S. and other rich countries.

title: Giuliani Retracts Account of Trump Tower in Moscow
summary: President's lawyer makes revelation on Sunday, then backtracks on Monday, saying his description was 'hypothetical'. WASHINGTON-A lawyer for President Trump gave conflicting statements about the timeline of negotiations during the 2016 campaign to build a Trump Tower in Moscow, suggesting on Sunday that those talks had continued through the election before backtracking on Monday.

title: Colombian Rebel Group Claims Responsibility for Police Bombing
summary: The National Liberation Army, or ELN, said it targeted Bogotá training center in last week's deadly bombing. BOGOTÁ, Colombia-The National Liberation Army, a Colombian rebel group, took responsibility for the car bomb that killed 20 cadets last week at a police academy, the worst terrorist attack to hit this South American country in 15 years.

title: Companies Try to Skirt Shutdown's IPO Limbo
summary: With IPO approvals frozen, biotechs consider going without SEC green light; energy firm faces potentially prolonged roadshow. The monthlong government shutdown is forcing some companies to seek alternate routes to go public because the main markets regulator is unable to green-light IPOs.

title: The World Braces for Slower Growth
summary: Resume Subscription. Get ready for chapter three in a shifting global growth story.

title: The Catch-22 That Globalization Faces Now
summary: A backlash against the downside of a more globalized economy has made it harder to implement policies to make it work more equitably. To understand the current state of globalization, consider what's happening at three of the primary institutions designed to promote it:
